answers.answer: Def sounds like your machine...did you happen to test on the same finger each time or a different one each time

Than it def sounds like your machine...I had that happen to me one time and it was because i had sugar on my finger and didnt realize it...so i test on another finger and it was way lower...but if you are testing on the same finger it def shouldnt change that fast
That's what I thought I always wash my hands before testing just in case I guess I will be callin my dr and the meter company in the morning to see what they say :-/ thank you for your help!!
You're welcome love hopefully they can help get it figured out

I hope so too this has been stressing me out bc I've worked so hard to change my diet and eat better with no cheating on my diet and the day this started happening my doctor told me I was doing so good controlling my sugars and I haven't changed anything at all in the last four days so I couldn't understand why it would be high all of a sudden
Yea some machines just mess up but luckily you caught it and can tell your Dr so they know what's been happening

question: Ok so the last four days my blood sugars have come back higher than normal for what I am eating I tested after dinner and my sugar came back at 154 I tested again because I didn't believe it was that high and it went down to 142 so then I test again and it was 132 all three tests were done within minutes of each other I don't understand how it can drop 22 points in less than a couple minutes is this normal or could something be wrong with my meter I'm starting to get really frustrated with this I don't know what I am doing wrong I even tested with the control stuff and that came back normal I don't know what to do someone please help???
title: Gestational diabetes question please help
